Products.service_desc:
Zscaler Internet Access Gov, part of the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange, defines safe, fast internet and SaaS access with the industry's most comprehensive cloud native security service edge (SSE) platform.  Zscaler's Zero Trust Exchange helps agencies achieve the target goals of the Executive Order 14028 and resulting OMB mandates, CISA guidance and directives.

ZIA Gov security products are currently utilized by over 100 federal agencies and federal systems integrators today in Zscaler's US-based FedRAMP Moderate and FedRAMP JAB High approved boundaries in support of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) 3.0 use case model for FedRAMP approved Policy Enforcement Point (PEP) capabilities. 

Delivered as a scalable SaaS platform from the world's largest security cloud, ZIA eliminates legacy network security solutions to stop advanced attacks and prevent data loss with a comprehensive zero trust TIC 3.0 compliant approach, fully supporting the CISA approved Branch Office, Remote Users, and Cloud use cases with:

Best-in-class, consistent security for today's hybrid workforce: When you move security to the cloud, all users, apps, devices, and locations get always-on threat protection based on identity and context. Your security policy goes everywhere your users go.
Secure cloud-based telework solution: Migrate to a cloud-first, cloud-secure Trusted Internet Connections (TIC) 3.0 zero-trust architecture that can accelerate cloud migration, enhance user productivity, and improve support for cloud applications.

Lightning-fast access with zero infrastructure: Direct-to-cloud architecture ensures a fast, seamless user experience. This eliminates backhauling, improves performance and user experience, and simplifies network administration - with no physical infrastructure, ever.

AI-powered protection from the world's largest security cloud: Inline inspection of all internet and SaaS traffic, including SSL decryption, with a suite of AI-powered cloud security services to stop ransomware, phishing, zero-day malware, and advanced attacks based on threat intelligence from 300 trillion daily signals.

Simplified management: Using a cloud native security solution infused with AI, streamlined workflows, and business focused policy creation frees up valuable time for your team to focus on strategic goals.

Zscaler Internet Access includes a comprehensive suite of AI-powered security and data protection services to help you stop cyberattacks and data loss. As a fully cloud-delivered SaaS solution, you can add new capabilities without any additional hardware or lengthy deployment cycles. The modules available as part of Zscaler Internet Access are:
- Cloud Secure Web Gateway (SWG)
- Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB)
- Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
- Cloud Firewall & IPS
- Cloud Sandbox
- Digital Experience Monitoring (ZDX) 

Zscaler will also provide our Zero Trust Exchange services at the FedRAMP Moderate level not only for federal agencies and service integrators, but state, local, education, and critical infrastructure as a fully authorized StateRAMP solution. 

All Zscaler's FedRAMP platforms are fully managed and supported by US Citizens and meet the ITAR, CJIS, and DFARS requirements and attestations. 

Zscaler, a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Security Service Edge.

Products.service_desc:
Zscaler Private Access Gov, part of the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange, enables fast, secure connections and allows your employees to work from anywhere using the internet as the corporate network. Based on the zero-trust principle of least-privileged access, it provides comprehensive security using context-based identity and policy enforcement. Zero Trust Exchange helps agencies achieve the target goals of the Executive Order 14028 and resulting OMB mandates, CISA guidance and directives.

ZPA Gov security products are currently utilized by over 100 federal agencies and federal systems integrators today in Zscaler's US-based FedRAMP Moderate and FedRAMP JAB High approved boundaries in support of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) 3.0 use case model for FedRAMP approved Policy Enforcement Point (PEP) capabilities. 

TIC 3.0 Use Case Examples (Branch Office, Remote Users, and Cloud)

Zero-trust VPN alternative: Legacy VPNs fail to deliver the security, visibility, and user experience today's distributed workforce requires. ZPA delivers fast, direct access to private apps by eliminating VPN traffic backhauling which creates latency, resulting in lost productivity. 

Secure Hybrid Workforce:  Users require the ability to move fluidly between their homes, remote locations, branch offices, and headquarters. ZPA enables seamless and secure access to private apps from wherever they need to work, on any device. Local users benefit from an identical experience through an on-prem broker that replicate the policies and controls of the cloud. 

Third-party Agentless Access: Third-party agencies, contractors, and vendors require secure, direct access to business applications and OT systems from unmanaged devices. ZPA provides secure, direct connectivity from authorized users to named applications without putting third parties on the network. With integrated agentless access, users can access applications from any browser, on any device, without the need to install a client or log into a VPN.

VDI alternative: Traditional VDIs are often slow, unresponsive, and introduce significant costs with racks of servers needed in the data center to support remote access needs. ZPA provides secure, direct connectivity to apps over RDP and SSH, enabling a faster, more secure experience for users. With built-in agentless access through the browser employees and third-party users get seamless secure connectivity from any device without complicated desktop provisioning processes.

Secure workload-to-workload connectivity: Agencies require fast, secure workload-to-workload connectivity across hybrid and multi-cloud environments. ZPA for Workloads reduces operational complexity and cost by eliminating the need for virtual DMZs and VPN meshes with least-privileged access-based connectivity across clouds. In addition, because workloads are hidden behind ZPA, they are invisible to the internet and impossible to attack.

Zscaler will also provide our Zero Trust Exchange services at the FedRAMP Moderate level not only for federal agencies and service integrators, but state, local, education, and critical infrastructure as a fully authorized StateRAMP solution. 

All Zscaler's FedRAMP platforms are fully managed and supported by US Citizens and meet the ITAR, CJIS, and DFARS requirements and attestations. 

Zscaler, a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Security Service Edge.

Assessors.name: 360 Advanced Compass Rose
Assessors.address: 200 Central Avenue, Suite 2100, St. Petersburg, FL  33701
Assessors.desc:
360 Advanced Compass Rose, Inc is an accredited Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) authorized to perform FedRAMP assessments. With a dedicated team of senior advisors, Compass Rose helps organizations navigate the complexities of FedRAMP requirements, providing rigorous testing and validation of security controls to ensure compliance with federal standards. As a 3PAO, Compass Rose offers end-to-end support, from initial preparation and gap analysis to the final assessment, ensuring a smooth and efficient path to FedRAMP authorization.

Compass Rose is well-equipped to support your government or federal compliance security needs, including FedRAMP, FISMA, NIST 800-171, StateRAMP, and the upcoming CMMC requirements. As a trusted assessor, 360 Advanced is also authorized to evaluate compliance across other critical frameworks such as ISO, PCI, SOC, and HITRUST.
Assessors.frameworks:
- ISO 27001
- SOC 1 / SSAE1 16
- SOC 2 / AT 101
- PCI-DSS
- HITRUST
- HIPAA/HITECH
- FISMA

Assessors.name: A-LIGN Compliance and Security, Inc. dba A-LIGN
Assessors.csp: A-LIGN Compliance and Security, Inc. dba A-LIGN
Assessors.address: 400 N Ashley Drive Suite 1325, Tampa, FL 33602
Assessors.desc:
A-LIGN is proud to serve as one of the most trusted federal assessors in the market with years of government-specific assessment experience, backed by an end-to-end compliance solution designed to ease your organization through the complex federal reporting and authorization process. A-LIGN is committed to ensuring the defense industrial base and its federal and state partners are secure against an increasing number of cybersecurity threats. To do so, we leverage a vast network of resources, experience, and professional relationships to ensure your organization is ready and approved to support government agencies, minimize risk, keep their data safe, and advance national cybersecurity.

As an accredited FedRAMP 3PAO, A-LIGN is able to conduct FedRAMP pre-assessments and security assessments based on the published templates and testing guidance. A-LIGN’s security assessors and dedicated penetration testing team execute the FedRAMP assessment in accordance with FedRAMP requirements.
 
A-LIGN is prepared to meet all your Government compliance and security needs including FedRAMP, FISMA, NIST 800-171, StateRAMP, and the upcoming CMMC requirements, in addition to multiple commercial compliance frameworks including SOC, ISO, PCI, and HITRUST.
Assessors.services: A-LIGN offers consulting services in order to prepare organizations prior to their FedRAMP assessment. Our experienced assessors can develop the required templates and supporting policies and procedures to prepare your company for the FedRAMP assessment. Additionally, A-LIGN can assist with POA&M remediation. Our consulting services help companies meet the rigorous FedRAMP requirements.

Assessors.name: AARC-360
Assessors.address: 8000 Avalon Boulevard, Suite 100, Alpharetta, GA 30009
Assessors.desc:
AARC-360 is a global, full-service firm specializing in IT Compliance and Cybersecurity services across all five continents.A PCAOB registered firm of Certified Public Accountants and Advisors, we combine deep insights gained across industries to provide Assurance, Advisory, Risk, and Compliance services. Our FedRAMP assessment team brings over 30 years of combined expertise with a specialty in cloud services. We are equipped to assist clients with a range of services, including Gap Assessments, Readiness Assessments, Initial and Annual Assessments, Significant Change Assessments, Red Team Exercises, Continuous Monitoring Support, Penetration Testing, and New Cloud Onboarding. 

Through our "test once, apply many" approach, clients can utilize multiple reporting frameworks, saving both time and money.  AARC-360 looks forward to helping our clients with an audit approach that is effective yet efficient.
Assessors.services:
AARC-360 provides a comprehensive suite of FedRAMP advisory support services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our objective is to prepare you for a successful assessment and ensure a seamless transition of the security package for your ongoing management post-Authorization to Operate (ATO).

Our services include FedRAMP Documentation Review and Development,FedRAMP Assessment Support (during and after the Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) audit, and FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring Support (advisory-focused).

These offerings are designed to guide organizations through the complexities of achieving and maintaining FedRAMP compliance, ensuring robust security measures and streamlined processes.

Assessors.name: Anthony Timbers LLC
Assessors.address: 1320 Central Park Blvd. Ste 200, Fredericksburg, VA, 22401
Assessors.desc:
Anthony Timbers LLC is a FedRAMP-recognized Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) and ISO/IEC 17020-accredited inspection body specializing in cybersecurity assessments for federal and commercial organizations. As an authorized 3PAO, we conduct independent FedRAMP security assessments using NIST SP 800-53 baselines, following FedRAMP’s official templates, testing procedures, and reporting standards.

A renowned and trusted cybersecurity firm, Anthony Timbers LLC has served as a federal contractor and has conducted security assessments and advisory work for countless state, local, and education (SLED) entities. Our team of certified professionals brings deep technical expertise across the DoD, federal civilian, and critical infrastructure sectors. We support Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) throughout the entire FedRAMP lifecycle—from initial readiness reviews to full security assessments—helping them achieve and maintain their Authority to Operate (ATO) with efficiency and clarity.

In addition to FedRAMP, Anthony Timbers LLC is an authorized CMMC Third-Party Assessment Organization (C3PAO), a PCI DSS Qualified Security Assessor (QSA), and a leading provider of penetration testing and assessment services aligned with frameworks such as NIST SP 800-171, NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), and HIPAA. Our mission is to empower secure, compliant cloud adoption through rigorous assessments and enduring partnerships.
Assessors.services: Anthony Timbers LLC offers strategic readiness consulting for CSPs pursuing FedRAMP and other regulatory certifications. Our consulting services include control gap analysis, documentation development (SSP, policies, procedures), POA&M remediation guidance, and pre-assessment dry runs. We also provide managed security services including penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, 24x7 monitoring, and incident response, helping organizations build compliant and resilient cloud environments.
Assessors.frameworks:
* CMMC
* NIST 800-171
* NIST CSF
* PCI DSS

Assessors.name: Aprio, LLP.
Assessors.address: N/A - Fully remote operations
Assessors.desc:
Securitybricks, Inc. - is a premier security advisory firm specializing in cloud security and compliance. Our team of experts are all U.S. citizens with over 15 years of consulting experience.  Securitybricks holds esteemed certifications such as CISSP, CCP, CEH, CCP, CRISC, and CIPM. Securitybricks is dedicated to delivering comprehensive and efficient FedRAMP assessments, tailored to the unique needs of Cloud Service Providers (CSPs).

**Our 3PAO Services include:** 

 - FedRAMP Gap Assessment
 - FedRAMP Readiness Assessment
 - FedRAMP Full/Initial Assessment
 - FedRAMP Annual Assessment
  -FedRAMP Significant Change Assessment
**FedRAMP Accelerator**
The FedRAMP accelerator from Securitybricks is an advanced application designed to streamline and automate the FedRAMP Authority to Operate (ATO) process. Built on the ServiceNow Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC): Policy and Risk Management module, this comprehensive solution helps organizations seeking FedRAMP certification to enhance their cybersecurity posture.  Key features include:
NIST 800-53 Framework Integration: It incorporates required control objectives from the NIST 800-53 framework, ensuring compliance with federal cybersecurity standards.
Evidence Collection and Management: Enables stakeholders to provide evidence to meet control requirements, streamlining the evidence collection process.
Stakeholder Assignment and Progress Tracking: Allows users to assign questionnaires to various stakeholders and track their progress towards compliance, ensuring accountability and visibility into the compliance status.
User-Friendly Interface: Built with a user-friendly interface, the application simplifies the process of building additional assessment questionnaires and provides a dashboard for easy navigation and monitoring.
Issue Tracking: Provides functionality for tracking and managing issues related to compliance, ensuring timely resolution of compliance issues.
Comprehensive Reporting and Dashboards: Offers reporting and dashboards for monitoring the FedRAMP compliance status, providing stakeholders with real-time insights into the organization's cybersecurity posture.
Connectivity to AWS and Azure: For workload information boundary definition, vulnerability assessment, and cloud configuration data.
Assessors.services:
**Consulting Services include:** 

Cloud Security Architecture: Advising on secure cloud infrastructure design.
Application Security: Strengthening the security of cloud-based applications.
Vulnerability Management: Identifying and mitigating security vulnerabilities.
Automation Solutions: Streamlining compliance processes with advanced automation tools

Assessors.name: bladestack.io (Advisory Focused)
Assessors.address: McLean, VA
Assessors.desc: Our technical focus does not make us lose sight of our clients' overarching goals. Whether it's business growth, cost optimization, or improved customer service, we ensure our technical advice aligns with these broader objectives.
Assessors.services:
bladestack.io leverages its unparalleled technical expertise to partner with CSPs in navigating the FedRAMP compliance landscape. Our services are tailored to fit your specific FedRAMP journey, whether you are just starting or already in the assessment phase. We conduct gap assessments, validate system boundaries, recommend solutions for missing capabilities, and provide strategic advisory for authorization paths and builds.
 
Our comprehensive offerings include:
 
 • Full FedRAMP Advisory: We develop complete FedRAMP documentation packages, crafting and authoring 100% of the documentation, including diagrams such as your Authorization Boundary. All documentation is customized to the CSP, with no template language used.
 
 • bladeRAMP: Our FedRAMP Accelerator service provides comprehensive turnkey FedRAMP environment builds, ensuring a seamless and efficient path to authorization.
 
 • Diagram Services: We develop all necessary diagrams and associated required deliverables, ensuring clarity and precision in your FedRAMP documentation.
 
 • PenTesting Services: We conduct simulated penetration tests and Red Team exercises to rigorously test your security posture.
 
 • Assessment Support: Our white-glove service facilitates the 3PAO assessment on your behalf, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.
 
 • Security Operations (SecOps) and Continuous Monitoring as a Service (CMaaS): We offer ongoing security operations and continuous monitoring to maintain compliance and security.
 
 • Enjinia (Engineering) Blade Division: Our engineering division provides technical advisory, hands-on implementation support, OSCAL package generation, and full environment build-outs.
 
Our established methodology is adaptable to your needs, eliminating guesswork and turning Federal Agency business opportunities into reality. bladestack.io ensures that your FedRAMP journey is efficient, comprehensive, and tailored to your unique requirements.

Assessors.name: COACT, Inc.
Assessors.address: 7021 Columbia Gateway Dr., Suite 310, Columbia, MD 21046
Assessors.desc:
COACT, Inc. is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), founded in 1990, that supports commercial and government clients in understanding and fulfilling their risk management and compliance needs. COACT evolved into a leading provider of high-reliance Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) services across multiple compliance frameworks. For over 30 years, COACT has provided consulting, Independent Verification & Validation (IV&V), and assessment services to both government and commercial clients. Our tiered service offerings range from focused efforts to address specific security objectives, to providing full information security programs for clients in the commercial, healthcare, regulatory, defense, and intelligence domains. With unrivaled ethics, COACT remains free from real or perceived conflicts of interest and does not engineer, manufacture, or resell any products.

 

COACT is able to perform FedRAMP consulting and assessment services to meet the needs of new and existing cloud service offerings. Our team of qualified assessors are available to assess cloud systems and continuously monitor the security posture of those systems in accordance with FedRAMP requirements. The output of our assessment services will provide the information needed to make critical risk-based decisions and demonstrate compliance with FedRAMP. COACT utilizes proven assessment methodologies and an accredited Quality Management System to ensure testing is targeted, effective, and produces actionable information for Authorizing Officials and other stakeholders.
Assessors.services: Our experienced FedRAMP consultants have proven expertise in assisting CSPs in improving their overall security posture and in developing compliant systems and security documentation. We provide consulting services to CSPs that require immediate support to develop or improve their information security program and generate the appropriate documentation in preparation for the FedRAMP assessment and authorization process. COACT is able to assist CSPs in the various phases of the system development life cycle in addition to migration to the cloud, if needed. COACT can assist in a wide spectrum of services including requirements analyses and traceability during the initiation of the authorization process to ensure developers maintain awareness and adhere to FedRAMP security requirements. In addition, COACT can develop the required FedRAMP system and security documentation needed prior to the assessment of a cloud system.
Assessors.csps: COACT provided FedRAMP consulting services to multiple CSPs since the initiation of the program. References can be provided upon request.

* StateRAMP - Consulting and Assessments
* FISMA - Consulting and Assessments
* HIPAA (Covered Entities and Associates) - Consulting and Assessments
* NIST SP 800-53 Compliance and Assessments
* NIST SP 800-171 Compliance and Assessments
* Limited Access Death Master File - Consulting and Assessments

Assessors.name: Coalfire Systems, Inc.
Assessors.address: 8480 E Orchard Rd, Suite 5800, Greenwood Village, CO 80111
Assessors.desc:
Coalfire delivers a full lifecycle of solutions through professional services, managed services, and technology platforms to help our clients solve their toughest cyber challenges. With more than 20 years of proven cybersecurity leadership, Coalfire combines extensive cloud expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative approaches to fuel success.

Our FedRAMP assessment team is comprised of qualified assessors prepared to support CSPs of all sizes and complexity. We continuously support our clients with the following types of assessments: gap assessment, readiness assessment, initial assessment, annual assessment, significant change assessment and new cloud service onboarding. Many of our clients leverage Coalfire’s coordinated assessment services where FedRAMP is assessed in parallel with other cyber frameworks (e.g., HITRUST, PCI-DSS) to reduce efforts associated with overlapping security control requirements.
Assessors.services:
Coalfire provides FedRAMP consulting services to CSPs interested in pursuing FedRAMP authorization for their products and services. Our consulting services include business case strategy workshops, compliance gap analyses, reference architecture design workshops, management plane and platform builds, full FedRAMP security package documentation development, assessment support, and managed services to conduct ongoing operations, maintenance, vulnerability management, and continuous monitoring.

Our consultants leverage their expertise as a premier FedRAMP consulting and assessment provider to inform clients on how to remediate gaps and meet stringent FedRAMP requirements with specific, practical solutions. Coalfire is prepared to meet our clients’ FedRAMP consulting needs from traditional engineering and compliance consulting to comprehensive, turnkey, FedRAMP environment builds.
Assessors.csps: Coalfire has provided FedRAMP consulting services to over 110 CSPs. References are available upon request.

Assessors.desc:
As an accredited Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO), we are proud to be recognized as one of the most trusted cybersecurity and privacy assessors in the market. With years of hands-on assessment experience, our team brings a proven track record of helping organizations navigate the rigorous compliance landscape with confidence. We offer an end-to-end compliance solution designed to simplify and streamline the complex federal reporting and authorization process.
 We are deeply committed to supporting our clients across a wide range of industry segments, including—but not limited to—the Defense Industrial Base (DIB), federal and state agencies, healthcare, fintech, and SaaS. Our mission is to help organizations strengthen their security posture in the face of growing cybersecurity threats. We ensure our clients are fully prepared and authorized to support government operations, minimize risk, protect sensitive data, and contribute meaningfully to the advancement of national cybersecurity objectives.
As an accredited FedRAMP 3PAO, we are authorized to conduct FedRAMP pre-assessments and full security assessments in accordance with published templates and testing guidance. Our experienced security assessors and specialized penetration testing team execute assessments with diligence and consistency, ensuring full alignment with FedRAMP requirements and helping our clients achieve and maintain authorization efficiently and effectively. 
In addition to our FedRAMP services, we provide independent cybersecurity and privacy assessment and audit services for a wide range of compliance standards including ISO/IEC 27001:2022, CMMC, SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR, and NIST SP 800-171. Our comprehensive services are designed to meet the evolving needs of organizations across industries—ensuring compliance, reducing risk, and building trust with stakeholders.
Assessors.services:
Our FedRAMP consulting services are designed to help organizations successfully prepare for FedRAMP authorization by providing expert guidance, documentation support, and remediation assistance. These services are ideal for cloud service providers seeking either a new FedRAMP Authority to Operate (ATO) or reauthorization.
 Key services include:
 • Development of FedRAMP-Compliant Documentation: We assist in drafting and refining key documents such as System Security Plans (SSPs), policies, procedures, and supporting templates that align with FedRAMP requirements.
 • Gap Assessment: We perform a thorough review of your current security posture to identify areas of non-compliance with FedRAMP controls.
 • POA&M Remediation Support: Our team provides actionable guidance to help you remediate Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) items efficiently.
 • Strategic Consulting: We offer end-to-end support, from early-stage planning to audit readiness, ensuring your team understands the expectations and timelines associated with FedRAMP authorization.
 In addition to FedRAMP, we offer a wide range of cybersecurity and privacy advisory services to help organizations strengthen their compliance posture across multiple standards and frameworks.
 Our broader consulting capabilities include:
 • ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Readiness and Implementation
 • SOC 2 Type I & II Gap Assessments and Audit Preparation
 • Security Risk Assessments (based on NIST, HIPAA, and other relevant standards)
 • Penetration Testing – Including internal/external network, web and mobile applications, and cloud infrastructure
 • Security Awareness Training – Tailored programs designed to educate staff and reduce human-related security risks
 NOTE:
 Independence of Assessment and Advisory Services
 
 In accordance with accreditation requirements and industry best practices, we maintain strict separation between our advisory and assessment functions. As such, we do not perform FedRAMP (or any other formal) assessments for clients to whom we have provided readiness or advisory services related to the same engagement.

Assessors.name: DataLock Consulting Group
Assessors.address: 4031 University Dr. Suite 100 Fairfax, VA 22030
Assessors.desc:
As an accredited 3PAO, DataLock Consulting Group provides Independent Assessment services for Cloud Service Providers (CSP), Third-party providers, and for Federal agencies. DataLock performs independent pre-assessments, readiness assessments, full FedRAMP security assessments and penetration testing. Several of our clients leverage our services to meet multiple compliance frameworks, making the process more efficient and less cumbersome on their organizational resources.

Our team is comprised of industry thought leaders, including NIST 800 series consultants and named authors. Our Assessors undergo a rigorous training program and hold industry leading certifications to ensure our clients are working with experts who understand information security and can analyze their unique systems and implementations.
Assessors.services:
DataLock Consulting Group provides cybersecurity and FedRAMP advisory services to Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) looking to achieve a FedRAMP authorization or enhance their security posture.  Our advisory services are tailored for each engagement, depending on each client's specific needs and where they are in their FedRAMP journey. For CSP's new to FedRAMP, our team begins the engagement with a technical architecture and engineering review, and a gap analysis of the most critical controls. A report is generated with specific recommendation to empower the CSP's technical and/or engineering team(s) to begin remediations. Our team will then begin to build out the FedRAMP package which includes all required documentation, as well as the development of FedRAMP compliant processes. As a part of the FedRAMP journey, our team works with all relevant stakeholders to educate the team on new process requirements to ensure the CSP becomes compliant and remains compliant after authorization. Our team also provides technical implementation where possible. We help organization manage and comply with multiple cybersecurity focused frameworks, such as FedRAMP, NIST 800-171, CMMC, SOC2, IRAP, and ISO 27000 to help lower their compliance burden.

Once the scope and schedule of each deliverable has been set, a certified security professional (typically a CISSP, CISA, CISM or OSCP) will lead a team of consultants. Our management team is deeply involved in the delivery of each project. Each project has an executive assigned to provide oversight and be accessible to each client.

Assessors.name: Emagine IT
Assessors.address: 909 Rose Avenue Suite 900, North Bethesda, MD 20852
Assessors.desc:
Based in the Washington, DC metropolitan area, Emagine IT (EIT) provides tailored cybersecurity and enterprise IT services to improve risk postures and deliver digital transformation to its commercial and federal customer. EIT specializes in delivering cost conscious, innovative solutions to meet the evolving business requirements of the clients we serve. As a Type C FedRAMP accredited Third Party Assessment Organization (3PAO), EIT is authorized to conduct independent security risk assessments for Cloud Service Providers (CSP) and deliver FedRAMP consulting services. EIT’s 3PAO services provide multiple levels of security assessment for CSP’s looking to comply with FedRAMP and Department of Defense (DoD) requirements. While many CSP’s set out to and achieve an Authority To Operate (ATO), others simply want to be held to the highest standard. With over 1,000 federal assessments based on NIST controls, EIT is ready to support your needs. We offer Gap Assessments, FedRAMP Assessments, Readiness Assessments, Turn-key SSP Documentation and Consulting, Penetration Testing, and Threat Hunting.

**FedRAMP Readiness Assessment / Readiness Assessment Report (RAR)**

Some organizations may opt to pursue a FedRAMP Readiness Assessment to help market their platform and attract an agency sponsor. This step toward your eventual FedRAMP authorization does not require a full penetration test, but you must still demonstrate a level of maturity aligned with the FedRAMP security framework. EIT can quickly support this FedRAMP stage with a four-week assessment timeline that may lead to your “FedRAMP Ready” designation on the FedRAMP Marketplace.

**FedRAMP Assessment & Attestation**

As a FedRAMP 3PAO, EIT has performed thousands of security assessments across the federal and commercial landscape. Because EIT has been on both sides of the process, we believe advisors make the best assessors. Our subject matter experts are not solely focused on checklists. They understand which findings are real, rather than false flags that disrupt and slow down the assessment process. Working with EIT means you are mitigating risk and maintaining the agreed-upon timelines. Through the FedRAMP assessment process, EIT will develop the required documentation, including a Security Assessment Plan (SAP), Security Requirements Traceability Matrix (SRTM) to document assessment results, Security Assessment Report (SAR), and recommendation for authorization.

**FedRAMP Advisory & Remediation**

Are you transitioning to a new FIPS-199 designation, requiring you to comply with more controls? Are you thinking about implementing a multi-cloud deployment strategy? Are you trying to find ways to leverage your current compliance and security investments to help you achieve your FedRAMP authorization? Working collaboratively with your teams, we will identify, understand, and help you overcome your unique FedRAMP compliance challenges as we walk you through your FedRAMP preparation. With the gap assessment in-hand, EIT will work with your team to map out and engineer the ideal system architecture and to document the necessary environment and security practices within your custom-tailored System Security Plan (SSP). Our advisory services can encompass various CSP systems and service models to ensure that timelines are defined and met, deficiencies in system architecture and policies are mended, understanding of FedRAMP controls and procedures is achieved, annual audits and ATO renewal process is smooth with dedicated continuous monitoring.

**Gap Assessment**

The first step in the certification process is to determine your organization’s readiness. How confident are you that you can move forward with your FedRAMP goals? Do you meet the FedRAMP showstoppers and critical controls? EIT will work with your team to identify how FedRAMP requirements may impact your organization’s operations and security architecture. These discovery activities are led by EIT’s subject matter experts through hands-on workshops and interviews with key personnel in your organization, culminating in a final report that describes critical gaps and prescribes recommendations for remediation.

**FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring (ConMonaaS)**

Maintaining documentation and systems that are outmoded but still essential can command more resources than most organizations can sustain. FedRAMP is a continuous program, rather than just a project with a start and end date. The EIT team will establish and assist with the monthly, quarterly, and annual continuous monitoring activities and reports required to maintain your authority to operate. This offering can be integrated with your organization’s many compliance requirements, such as CMMC, FISMA, HITRUST, ISO, and more.
Assessors.services:
Emagine IT provides expert advisory services that grant Cloud Service Providers everything that is needed to pass assessments and obtain/renew their ATOs. By leveraging our advisory services, Cloud Service Providers receive the guidance needed to refine security documentation and procedures.

Our advisory services can encompass various CSP systems and service models to ensure that timelines are defined and met, deficiencies in system architecture and policies are mended, understanding of FedRAMP controls and procedures is achieved, annual audits and ATO renewal process is smooth with dedicated continuous monitoring, all while following Emagine IT’s methodology proven to reduce time and cost.

Emagine IT will conduct readiness reviews to determine completion of deliverables and project timelines for FedRAMP package submissions.

Therefore, we begin with a preliminary gap analysis, providing your decision-makers with a clear picture of program costs, timelines, and internal resource demands to make an informed decision about whether to pursue FedRAMP operational authority. As an accredited 3PAO, our professionals provide assessment support services, including assessment planning, assessment and package testing (audit) and submission of the final assessment to the FedRAMP Program Management Office (PMO). SecureIT partners with CSP's to help them navigate the challenges of achieving FedRAMP compliance. We provide services tailored to where you are in their FedRAMP journey and are adept in aiding CSPs from initial consideration of pursing authorization through your assessments, and beyond.  Our experts remove the guesswork from your FedRAMP authorization pursuit to help you make business opportunities with Federal Agency customers a reality.  SecureIT has established a proven FedRAMP advisory methodology that is customizable to provide the level of support needed for your organization.  Our suite of FedRAMP Advisory services include:

* Gap assessment & validation of system boundary
* Solution recommendation for missing capabilities
* Authorization path and build/design strategic advisory
* Development of full FedRAMP documentation package
* Simulated FedRAMP penetration tests
* Red Team exercises
* FedRAMP package validation & “dry run” assessments
* 3PAO assessment facilitation
* FedRAMP Program oversight & management
* Board & executive management briefings
* Continuous Monitoring as a Service (CMaaS)
* Vulnerability scanning & POA&M management 
* In-boundary Security Operations Center (SOC)
* Traditional engineering and comprehensive turnkey FedRAMP environment builds
* OSCAL package generation & transmission
Assessors.csps: SecureIT has provided FedRAMP Advisory services to 75+ IaaS/PaaS/SaaS CSPs.  Specific customer references can be provided upon request.

Assessors.name: Securisea, Inc.
Assessors.address: 201 Spear St Suite 1100 San Francisco, CA 94105
Assessors.desc:
The Securisea 3PAO security practice leverages our deep expertise in assessing some of the most advanced and complex Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) in the world. Our 3PAO services include preparation of Readiness Assessment Report (RAR) in order to be listed as FedRAMP Ready, full 3APO assessments for both Agency and Provisional-ATOs, vulnerability scanning penetration testing, and continuous monitoring of services with existing ATOs.

Our integrated compliance approach allows us to leverage our client’s existing security controls from other frameworks directly into each 3PAO assessment, reducing overhead and work duplication. As experts in a wide variety of security control frameworks, we can provide a comprehensive solution for all of your security assessments.
Assessors.services:
Securisea consulting services span the entire security landscape, including but not limited to:
* Penetration testing
* Security architecture
* Web application security
* Secure code reviews
* Training
* Secure software development lifecycle
* Security policy development
* Reverse engineering
* Risk assessments/risk management
* Cryptography

Assessors.name: Sentar, Inc.
Assessors.address: 675 Discovery Drive NW, Suite 205, Huntsville, AL 35806
Assessors.desc:
Sentar 3PAO has an extensive history providing assessment services, leveraging our collective experience in auditing, compliance, information technology and cloud computing to expand our scope to include FedRAMP in order to service Cloud Service Providers (CSP). Our talented personnel share six years of experience in assessing companies against FedRAMP requirements. 
  
Assessment services include the following: 

* FedRAMP Ready Assessment and submission of Ready Assessment Report (RAR)
* FedRAMP Gap Assessment and Client will receive a Gap Assessment Report (GAR)
* FedRAMP Full Security Assessment and submission of Security Assessment Plan (SAP) and Security Assessment Report (SAR)
* FedRAMP Annual Assessments
Assessors.services:
As part of our consulting services, Sentar 3PAO can help ensure CSPs are prepared for a successful assessment by a 3PAO.

Sentar’s Consulting Support Packages include the following options:

* Customized FedRAMP Training to explain the criteria your Cloud Service Offering (CSO) will need to meet in order to successfully achieve FedRAMP authorization;
* Gap assessment to determine current baseline and analysis of gaps
* Development of FedRAMP Security Authorization Package 
* Remediation Services
* Independent annual assessments 
* Continuous Monitoring activities
* Scans and Penetration Testing

Assessors.name: Sera Brynn, LLC
Assessors.address: Sera Brynn LLC 12977 N. Outer 40 Rd Suite 110 St. Louis, MO 63141
Assessors.desc:
Sera Brynn provides a team of highly skilled assessors and qualified information security consultants. Our assessors are dedicated to providing quality assessments for different security frameworks that are needed to meet multiple business requirements. As a trusted FedRAMP assessor, Sera Brynn specializes in evaluating and validating Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) to ensure compliance with rigorous federal security standards. Our team utilizes experienced assessors and rigorously tested methodologies to execute and deliver valuable results to each client. Our comprehensive understanding of FedRAMP requirements is maintained through meticulous evaluation, identification and actionable reporting that enhances your security posture.

 

Our assessment team and process are both rigorous and collaborative. In order to deliver timely results, the process includes close coordination with Cloud Services Providers to ensure a smooth and efficient evaluation. Transparency and communication are integral to guiding our clients through each step of the FedRAMP journey, from the initial readiness assessment to the final authorization. At Sera Brynn, we are committed to empowering cloud services providers with the knowledge and support need to achieve and maintain FedRAMP compliance.
Assessors.services:
At Sera Brynn, we offer experienced, certified, and qualified information security consultants that can guide businesses through preparation and execution of complicated audits while maintaining robust security programs on a year-round basis. Information security programs have a high impact on businesses, creating opportunities for growth as well as securing current business contracts and agreements. Sera Brynn continues to support companies a all shapes and sizes that take their information security requirements seriously and focuses on helping those organizations with those responsibilities.

 

Sera Brynn believes that information security programs do not begin and end just with documentation. As a trusted consulting provider, the documentation of an information security program means that the policies, plans, procedures, and reports correctly show continuous management and improvement of an information security program. Continuous information security program management involves risk assessment, pattern analysis, incident response preparation, internal security assessments, and understanding the business of the organization that the information security program is being applied. At Sera Brynn, our holistic approach to security not only enhances compliance readiness but fosters a culture of resilience, empowering organizations to thrive in an increasingly challenging landscape.
Assessors.csps: Sera Brynn is proud to currently serve 5 clients, providing dedicated assessments and tailored information security consulting services to respond to compliance requirements and enhance business information security efforts. Our dedicated team works closely with each client, providing value through experienced and qualified individuals as well as certified teams for increased value. We are committed to building strong partnerships that empower our clients to navigate the complexities of information security and compliance requirements with confidence.

* Dfir

Assessors.name: SteelToad
Assessors.address: 5520 Research Park Dr, Suite 100, Baltimore MD, 20905
Assessors.desc:
With 25 years of proven experience in cybersecurity across the Department of Defense (DoD), NSA and the Federal Government, our team brings deep cloud expertise and strategic security insight into every engagement.  Whether you are seeking an Authority to Operate (ATO) or want to demonstrate your commitment to the NIST standards for security and compliance – SteelToad can help. With experience performing federal assessments, our team is composed of highly skilled professionals ready to support Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) at any stage of their compliance journey. We provide full lifecycle assessment services, including:
•        New Cloud Service Onboarding
•        Gap Assessments
•        Readiness Assessments
•        Initial Assessments
•        Annual Assessments
•        Significant Change Assessments
•        Red Teaming and Penetration Testing
•        Documentation and Reporting
•        Continuous Monitoring Support (Assessment-Focused)
At SteelToad, we are dedicated to helping clients overcome their most complex cybersecurity challenges with clarity, confidence, and compliance. Lock It Down.
Assessors.services:
SteelToad offers comprehensive FedRAMP consulting services to Cloud Service Providers (CSPs).  Our expert team guides clients through every phase of the FedRAMP journey, delivering:
FedRAMP Readiness Assessments
•	Evaluate whether a Cloud Service Offering (CSO) is technically prepared for the FedRAMP authorization process.
•	Deliver a Readiness Assessment Report (RAR) that validates the implementation of required security capabilities
Security Documentation Support
•	Assist Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) in preparing key FedRAMP documentation such as:
•	System Security Plans (SSPs)
•	Security Assessment Plans (SAPs)
•	Security Assessment Reports (SARs)
•	Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
Gap Analysis and Remediation Guidance
•	Identify gaps between current security posture and FedRAMP requirements.
•	Provide actionable recommendations to close those gaps before formal assessment.
Security Architecture and Control Implementation Consulting
•	Advise on secure system design aligned with NIST SP 800-53 controls.
•	Help implement technical and administrative controls effectively.
Pre-Assessment Advisory
•	Offer mock gap assessments or pre-audits to simulate the FedRAMP process.
•	Help CSPs understand what to expect and how to prepare.
Continuous Monitoring Support
•	Guide CSPs in setting up continuous monitoring processes.
•	Assist with monthly and annual reporting requirements post-authorization.

Assessors.name: TalaTek, LLC
Assessors.address: 6900 E. Camelback Road Suite 900 Scottsdale, AZ 85251
Assessors.desc: TalaTek helps partners make the FedRAMP process a stepping stone to success versus an obstacle that stands in your way. If you’re a CSP who feels ready to become an approved FedRAMP provider, TalaTek’s certified 3PAO services will help you conduct a fair and independent assessment of your systems so that you can seek an agency-sponsored ATO or JAB Provisional ATO. Our unparalleled expertise with the rigorous and unique requirements of the FedRAMP assessment process means we can provide a thorough and timely assessment that will identify any and all residual risk within an information system. We guide clients through the multiple layers of the submission process in order to obtain FedRAMP certification.
Assessors.services:
We specialize in providing one-on-one advisory services to Cloud Service Providers working through the FedRAMP process. We help guide our partners through the multi-tiered steps of receiving an ATO through the FedRAMP process. Our goal is to ensure that our partners meet all FedRAMP security standards the first time, in order to reduce risk of delays and further operating costs. Our multi-faceted support program includes:
* Helping our partners understand FedRAMP standardization and compliance requirements, as well as the best-practice approaches to becoming FedRAMP-certified
* Providing an initial Gap Analysis to focus on potential areas of non-compliance
* Providing an in-depth control implementation review to identify and remediate potential areas of weakness, as well as gathering necessary artifacts to demonstrate control implementation
* Providing a thorough review of existing system documentation, and development of additional system documents, as required
* Providing a complete, step-by-step development of your system’s security authorization package.
Assessors.frameworks:
* FedRAMP
* ISO
* PCI
* SOC
* FISMA
* DIACAP

Tevora’s Federal Services Team is an accredited FedRAMP 3PAO that offers a comprehensive collection of accredited 3PAO services which are tailored to support individual CSPs in maintaining cost effective strategic initiatives for compliance with FedRAMP, FISMA, Office of Management and Budget (OMB), and other Federal civilian and Department of Defense (DoD) mandates. Tevora provides meaningful feedback throughout each project to help CSPs efficiently navigate the FedRAMP assessment and authorization process in partnership with the FedRAMP PMO and Agency sponsor.

Tevora’s Federal Services include:
* Strategy Roadmap Development

* Development of System Security Plans (SSP)
* Gap and Readiness Assessment Report (RAR)
* Remediation Services
* Penetration Testing

* Accredited 3PAO Continuous Monitoring Services
Assessors.services: Tevora is a leading management consulting firm specializing in enterprise risk, compliance, information security solutions, and threat research. We offer a comprehensive portfolio of information security solutions and services to clients in virtually all industries and also serve institutional and government clients.

Assessors.name: Wilson Consulting Group, LLC
Assessors.address: 800 Maine Avenue SW, Suite 200, Washington D.C. 20024
Assessors.desc:
As an accredited FedRAMP 3PAO authorized by the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) to conduct security assessments for CSPs seeking FedRAMP Ready and Provisional/Agency Authorizations, Wilson Consulting Group provides the following services to assist organizations in pursuing FedRAMP ATO.

**Readiness Assessment**
WCG reviews the environment and conduct a technical capability assessment to determine if it meets FedRAMP security requirements, which results in a Readiness Assessment Report (RAR). 

**Full Security Assessment**
WCG performs an independent assessment of the system to evaluate critical control implementation and verifies compliance level to FedRAMP requirements and NIST SP 800-53 Revision 5 controls. A 3PAO-required Security Authorization Package will be developed, including a Security Assessment Plan (SAP), Security Assessment Report (SAR), and a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M). Vulnerability and penetration testing are also in the scope.

**Continuous Monitoring Services**
WCG provides ongoing support with risk evaluation to maintain organization's FedRAMP ATO."
Assessors.services:
WCG provides consulting and advisory services throughout the FedRAMP process and assists organizations with Security Artifact Creation such as Security Assessment Plan (SAP), System Security Plan (SSP), Security Assessment Report (SAR), and Plan of Action and Milestone (POA&M) to get clients prepared for the upcoming FedRAMP assessment and authorization.

WCG also provides the following as part of its consulting services:

* Assist organizations to determine their cloud solution’s proper Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-199 categorization of the risk level.
* Conduct Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing.
* Conduct gap analysis to evaluate the sufficiency of security controls to determine organizations’ compliance level with FedRAMP requirements.
* Evaluate, review, and revise the Incident Response Plan, Process, and Procedures to ensure they sufficiently address FedRAMP requirements.

* HIPAA / HITECH

* SOC 2 Audit
